title: Drawing, "Design for inkstand", 1800–25
medium: Brush and yellow, red watercolor, black wash, graphite, on cream laid paper
inscribed: Below center, in brown ink: No. 56183; in graphite: 185
creditline: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
description: Rectangular box on black base. Long drawer in open position decorated with center rosette, flanked by stylized leafed motif. Inkstand supported by two lion chimerae. A bell at center is flanked by square inkpots, engraved cover on left inkpot. Arms with sockets, presumably to hold pens, at either end.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for inkstand", 1800–25.
1800–25. Brush and yellow, red watercolor, black wash, graphite, on cream laid paper. Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt. 1931-64-153.
